column1: txt
(on the phone) hey, so you know how I've always had a thing for half-Asian girls? Well, now I've got a new favorite: Lebanese girls! Lebanese girls are the new half-Asians.
Okay, meet me at the bar in fifteen minutes, and Suit up!
Where's your suit!? Just once when I say suit up, I wish you'd put on a suit.
It was a blazer!
I see what this is about. Have you forgotten what I said to you the night we met?
Ted, I'm going to teach you how to live. (Ted's shocked) Barney, we met at the urinal.
Lesson one, lose the goatee. It doesn't look good with your suit.
Lesson two, get a suit. Suits are cool. (Points to self with bear bottle in hand) Exhibit A. (Flirts to a woman unseen) Lesson three, don't even think about getting married till you're... thirty.
I thought I was your best friend. Ted, say I'm your best friend.
Good! And as your best friend, I suggest we play a little game called... "Have you met Ted?"
(Taps a woman names Yasmine) Hi, have you met Ted? (Leaves and watches from a distance).
(ignoring) how does Carl land a Lebanese girl?
Exactly-the guy doesn't even own a suit!
(to Robin) Hey, have you met Ted?
(comes back laughing) De-wait for it-nied! Denied!
I thought we were playing laser tag tomorrow night?
(Phone) Hey loser, how's not playing laser tag? Because playing laser tag is awesome! Oh, I killed you Connor; don't make me get your mom!
Okay, meet me at the bar in fifteen minutes-AND SUIT UP!
I can't believe you're still not wearing a SUIT!
What is she goanna-is she goanna bat her eyes at you in Morse code (bats eyes)?? Ted (bats eyes) Kiss me-No, you just kiss her!
Ee-(Kisses Marshal) Did Marshall give me the signal?
But see-at least, tonight, I get to sleep knowing, Marshall and Me... never going to happen. You should've kissed her.
A week? That's like-a year in hot girl time. She'll forget all about you. Mark my words: you will never see that one again.
Actually, that is a perfect metaphor. By the way, did I congratulate you two? (Raises glass to Lily and Marshall)
Alright, but under one condition.
(happy) look at you, you beautiful b*st*rd, you suited up! This is totally going in my blog!
Ted's goanna get it on with a TV reporter (nods. Laughs.) This just in. Okay (holds hand up for high-fives)
Why does he get to be the best man? (Shouts out) I'M YOUR BEST FRIEND!
You're wearing a suit!
So, (looks to the cabdriver) Ranjit... you must've done it with a Lebanese girl.
The women hot there?
(Whispers to Marshall) Simple no would have sufficed. (To Ranjit) She's lovely.
So, Marshall. This "Olive Theory" based on you and Lily?
You hate olives? Lily loves them, you can't stand them.
Two weeks ago, Spanish bar on 79th Street, dish of olives-you had some. What up?
I swear.
But you like olives!
Marshall, I'm going to get you an early wedding present. Don't get married.
What?

Come on man, you said your stomach's been hurting, right? You know what that is! Hunger. You're hungry for experience. Hungry for something new. Hungry for olives. But you're too scared to do anything about it.
Why are we still sitting here? Let's go! We can still make last call. What do you say Lil? (Pirate Accent) Yo, ho ho and a bottle o' rum? (Silence) 'Cuz you're a pirate...
You think they're doing it in front of the dogs?
I had this girl in college; she had a golden retriever-
Hit it Ranjit. (They drive off)
There's no such thing as the signal. But yeah-that was the signal.
Yeah Ted, we're not on you anymore.
I suggest we play a little game I like to call, "Have you Met Ted?"
(Taps Robin's shoulder) Hi! Have you met Ted? (Leaves)
(hits him) No! As your sponsor I will not let you relapse. You blew it; it's over-move on.
Yeah, cuz nothing says "Casual" like inviting a hundred people over just to "Mac" on one girl. Oh, and Lily-that's my leg.
What's so special about the roof?
Solid plan, my little friend.
But may I suggest one little modification.
That foxy young thing you were chatting up, take her up to the roof and have s*x with her! Crazy monkey-style.
Should be the plan, I mean look at her. Ted, look at her. She's smokin'!

Exactly! Ted, let's wrap. Statistic, at every New York party there's always a girl who has no idea whose party she's at. She knows no one you know, and you will never see her again. Do you see-where I'm going-hu-with this?
Aargh! (Pulls down imaginary scope) Scoping, beep, scoping, beep!
beep, beep, beep, beep. Target acquired! And now it's time we play a little game I like to call "Have You Met Ted?"
(taps woman) Hi! Have you met Ted?
Do you know Marshall? Lily?
Hmm, do you know anyone at this party?
Excuse me, (to group) Anyone know a Carlos?
On a silver platter! Bon appetite!
Your loss, her gain. (To Tatiana) Excuse me, can I show you the roof? It's magical up there!
Dude, Robin's not coming.

Oh, you were so right about the roof. The roof. The roof is on fire, Ted! Girl from last night, took her back to my place then this morning took her outside, spun her around a couple of times sent her walking-she will never find her way back and there she is. How did she get here? Did you invite her?
She said she works with Carlos, who's Carlos?
Grr. (Turns around) Hi, you. You're back.
"sweetie"? Really? (They walk into the kitchen Barney mouths) Sweetie?
So, it's over between me-and-works with Carlos girl.
Yeah, I was trying to think what's the quickest way to get rid of a girl you just met?
I think I'm in love with you.
Thanks, bro (walks away)
Oh, this is lame.
lame.
Of course.
Who? Who invited you? No one even know who you are!
Who is Carlos!?
Yeah well, "the one" is heading up to "the roof". (Robin leaves to the roof with Carlos)
Unbelievable. That is just a recipe for disaster, they work together (Carlos and Tatiana are making out)
Oh, please, what does Carlos have that I don't?
I'm not sure I like her.
(On Phone) MacLaren's is bore, snore. Ted, tonight we're going to go out. We're going to meet some ladies. It's going to be legendary. Phone-five! (High-fives the phone)
You didn't phone-five did you? I know when you don't phone-five, Ted. Come on, we always go to MacLaren's.
MacLaren's is this much fun. What I'm offering is the chance to have this much fun.
This hand gesture thing doesn't really work on the phone, does it?
Get in the cab. Marshall you too.
I understand. (To Ted) Get in the cab.
Uhh... because he's getting laid.
(Doing "I see you" hand motion) Ted, Ted, Ted. Right here. You keep going to the same bar, you're in a rut and I am a rut buster. I'm going to bust your rut (Smiles).
Ted, what's the first syllable in rutting (trying to make it sound like "routine". Ted gives in and jumps in the cab) Peace out, suckers. (Cab speeds off.)
First we got to pick someone up at the airport.
(To cabdriver) Estaban, doors! (Cab doors lock)
Just this one little thing and the rest of the night is ours.
I don't know. Maybe her? Or her.

(winks) Scenario. Couple of girls fly into town, looking for a fun weekend in NYC when they meet two handsome international business men just back from a lucrative trip to Japan. Sample dialogue, "You have a wheelie bag? Wh... I have a wheelie bag!"
False. Sidebar, tuck in your shirt. You look sketchy.
Trust me, it's going to be legendary.
We're building an igloo in Central Park. It's gonna be legendary. Snow suit up!

Ted, Ted, Ted. Right here! This is happening. Now you can either put your bags on the carousel now, or you can listen to me give you a really long speech convincing you to put the bags on the carousel. Your move. (Silence) Ted, since the dawn of time mankind has struggled... (Ted puts bags on carousel)
Okay, carousel four is tapped out. Ready? Because I'm about to drop some knowledge. Cute girls are not from Buffalo. Time-out. Ten o'clock. You ready to rock this, Tedder?
Ted, you klutzy, great guy, you! (Barney shoves Ted into two lady's cart and Ted trips backwards. To Women) Hey, Barney. (Adjusts tie)
Philly? That's where we're headed!
Yes, you will. (Girls leave. To Ted) Follow them, tickets on me.
Hey, is that Marshall? (Takes Phone) Marshall, stop whatever you're doing, get in that hoopty-ass Vierro of yours and come meet us in Philly. It's going to be legendary.

Yeah, yeah, yeah... I sent you some pictures on my phone, check it. (Pictures show Barney doing "I see you" hang gesture) Philly! (Hangs up. To Ted) Admit it, you're having fun. This much fun. Thirty-five thousand feet of fun!
Let's go talk to those girls.
Ted, you've been living your whole life in a seatbelt. It's time to unclick. (Unclicks)
(sits back down) Yeah, sorry, sorry.
(To Ted) No! No! The night is just started. Look, airport bar. Flight attendants! They'll get your tray table at its full upright position. Say what? (Goes for a high five)
Don't say you're going to kill someone in front of airport security, not cool. (To security) Not cool.
This is an outrage. We are international businessmen on an international business trip. I demand you release us immediately.
(To Ted) Those bags were your responsibility.
(Stopping him) Please. (Silence) We are international businessmen. My colleague accidentally left the bags there now please let us go before we miss our international business meeting.
Believe it or not, that duff bag thing worked.
We are international businessmen...
Dude, seriously, relax.
Exactly! (To Ted) We have a lawyer?
Relax, Ted. We didn't do anything wrong. And, B.T.W, we'd be out of here by now if you'd have tucked in your shirt. (Ted turns his head to face away from Barney)
(To Ted) We're going to Sascha's?

Sascha. (Points to Security Woman) She's having friends over for drinks at her house. It's goanna be legen... wait for it...and I hope you're not lactose intolerant 'cuz the second half of that word is... dairy.
Legendary!
(On Phone) Marshall, we're going to Sascha's!
(On Phone) Ted, Ted, Ted. (Does I'm watching you hand gesture) Yes, we are.
So, uh... you're Sascha's friends, huh?
Philly!
(Whispers) Philly!
(Laughs) Did you hear that, Ted? Dana works security at the Liberty Bell.
Wow it must be really well cornered off over there. You ever go behind the rope and touch it?
Ever, like, stick your head inside it?
D'you ever lick it?
Hmm... I bet nobody in history has ever licked the Liberty Bell! If someone were to pull that off I dare say it would be... what's the word?
Legendary, Ted, LEGENDARY!
Could have licked the Liberty Bell.
Bong, bong...
Ted, Ted... you're not even looking.

Look, our forefathers died for the pursuit of happiness, okay. Not for the sit around and wait of happiness. Now if you want, you can go to the same bar, drink the same beer talk to the same people everyday, or you can lick the Liberty Bell! You can grab life by the crack and lick the crap out of it!
Thanks, Leonard. Ted, you're missing out on a valuable life lesson!
No, it has to be the two of us.

Because, you're my best friend, alright? You don't have to tell me I'm yours. But the way I see it, we're a team. Without you, I'm just the dynamic uno. You know what, fine. If you wanna go home... then we'll go home.
Good, (smiles) 'cuz we're here! (Hops out)
Booger.
Not some stupid word, "Booger".
What? Journalist? You do the little fluff pieces at the end of the news. Old people, babies, monkeys... that's not journalism, that's just things in a diaper.
Of course not, because now you're saying "Nipple" and it's a hundred! (Whispers) Step into my web.
Hold up, there are only two reasons to date a girl you've already dated. Breast, Implants.
You dumped a p0rn star? Friendship over (gets up) FRIENDSHIP OVER!
There she is. Hey is it cold in here, because I can kind of see Robin's nickels? Now for your next challenge...
Oh, search your soul, Robin. You and I both know this wasn't about the money. Sure, Metro News One pays you jack and hey, a little green salad on the side's good for you, me and Mr. McGee.

Well baby really likes, is the thrill of pulling one over on those bean counters, who under appreciate you and still haven't promoted you. And for two more hundy-sticks, baby's going to look in the camera and say this (Whispers in her ear)
Did you sleep with her sister?
Sleep with her mom?
I'm losing interest in your story.
Know, that was a big mistake, Ted. You should've done it in person.
Desperate "Please-don't-leave-me" s*x is amazing.
You know what else? My younger sister just got married and I'm about to turn thirty-sex. Fantastic.
You know, that Natalie... she's good times.
She's probably on the subway by now. You could call her Voice Mail. Beep, dumped. Click. Done!
Mm... Mm! Six words! You... look... fat... in... those... jeans..., you're free to go.
Seriously, honey, men are working, here.

And great TV was had by all. Alright Scherbatsky, new challenge. And this one's big. But so, is the cash reward. For one thousand dollars, you heard me, all you have to do is get up there on the news and do one of these... (does odd dance)

And as you do it, you say this, "Elbert Ickey Woods. The bangles were fools to cut you in '91. Your 1521 rushing yards and your 27 touch downs will not be forgotten. So Coach Dave Shullah, screw you and your crappy steakhouse."
Ahh! This is it.
(To everyone in the bar) Everyone, everyone... If I may direct your attention to the television. You're about to see something... amazing.
Come on, baby... bring it home.
No, Marshall. That was beyond my wildest dreams (Robin's wailing on TV)
But isn't it nice to know that people are watching?
Hey, Ted, you know what always picks me up when I'm down? Other people's misfortune. You missed something so amazing.
Fine.
"Okay"!? Awesome!!
"Okay" is the name of a club. Yeah, it's supposed to be incredibly exclusive. This friend of mine once waited outside for two hours, he couldn't get in.
No... a friend of mine named, shut up.
Yeah, he just wants to show you his own VIP if you know what I mean...
All the things you do when you know where the next ten thousand lays are coming from.
Translation, she's ugly, she's ugly, she ugs in the ugly.
So, do you have any other hot single fr...
(enters) And his hair was perfect.
One of the twenty-four similarities between girls and fish is that they're both attracted to shiny objects. You really never read my blog, do you?
What the hell happened to these two?
Wow, who knew being committed in a heterosexual relationship could make a guy so gay.
My, oh, my there are some ferocious looking cutlets here tonight. Alright, hookup strategy, colon, find a cutlet; lock her in early, grind with her all night till she's mine.
Question is: do these strategies ever not work for me? Either way the answer's "about half the time".
You think?
(Subtitle) Okay, it's a little loud.
(Subtitle) Oh hey, I can't see her face. Is she hot?
Maybe theres...
a machine in...
The restroom.
Ted, bring your coat, we're leaving.
That was my cousin, Leslie.

No, no, no... we are not laughing about this, Ted. This is not going to be some funny story that we'll be telling in a couple months. It's not gonna be like, "Hey, remember that time when you were grinding with... NO! And you know why? Because, italics, this night did not happen. And you promise me that you will never, ever, ever tell another soul what transpired here tonight. You promise. Promise
Why, I didn't check a coat. And even if I did, on principle tip jars have become so...
FINE! Just... eh. (Leaves)
THEY PLAYED SOME GOOD SONGS TONIGHT.
WHAT?
WHAT?
THAT PLACE MAKES GREAT SALADS!

You know what I love about Halloween? It's the one night of the year chicks use to unleash their inner ho-bag. If a girl dresses up as she a witch, she's a slutty witch. If she's a cat, she's a slutty cat. If she's a nurse...
She's a slutty nurse.
Awww.
And she called it the Tootsie Roll.
Because it tastes like an alcoholic Tootsie Roll.
Something went terribly wrong.
You know, Ted, it's been four years. She could be engaged or married or, God forbid, fat.
No, no, not again. Not this year. You're going as my wingman. Flight suit up!

Oh you're dangerous, Maverick. Your ego's writing check your body can't cash. OK. Here's the plan, and I crap you not. I'm getting us into the Victoria's Secret Halloween party. Trust me, by the end of the night, your chad will not be hanging.

Hm, (putting up left hand) Victoria's Secret models prancing around in bras and panties, or (putting up right hand) Yale preppies reuniting their stupid a capella group. What's that left hand? Right hand sucks? Word.
Well, boys, looks like it's just the three of us. What's that? Self-five? Nice. (high fives himself) We out.
I can't believe you talked me into this.
This party sucks. There are seven chicks here.
There are six chicks here.
Hey.
So, what does a fella have to do to get lei'd around here? Yeah.
It isn't funny if you explain the joke.
Let's bail.
Name one person you know at this party.
OK, I'm leaving, but just know that this Victoria's Secret party is on a yacht. And what will be sticking to that yacht? The Barnacle. (points to self)
Yeah, the Barnacle.
That's it. Barnacle out. (Barney walks away)
That's right.
Every Halloween, I bring a spare costume in case I strike out with the hottest girl at the party. That way I have a second chance to make a first impression.
What's with the face?
So go to the bathroom.
So pee off the roof. Ooh, Ted, pee off the roof.
Come on, Ted, who are you going to listen to? Me or Mr. Goody-goody over there.
Let me guess. Every guy has used the lei'd line on you tonight.
I apologize for my gender. Let me make it up to you. Make you a drink.
I'm also a horny devil. (pointing to horns on top of head) Yeah.
OK Victoria's Secret party right now.
Come on, I can't stand to watching my delusional friend waste another precious Halloween. The Slutty Pumpkin is not coming.
Oy.
Wow. I did not understand a word you just said. Lingerie models on a boat!
No, see ya. (evil laughs, sparks something in his hands) Ow.
You are such a loser. Come on, I came back for you, Ted. I penguin-suited up to show you the error of your ways. And to score hula girl's number. Check and check.
Yes, it is.
What? No no, that's some other guy and he was a kick-ass fighter pilot
Yeah, well, you did, thanks.
Uh, I don't think so. I earned it fair and square. I'm calling you.
But how will you know it's me? I'm a master of disguise. Yeah.
Come on, Ted, Victoria's Secret party now. Let's go.
Fine. Fine. (puts his flipper up towards Ted)
I'm flippering you off.
What the? Haha, joke's on you, I have a cold.
Marshall ran away from a cockroach.
Oh, yeah, sorry, my bad. You're a man.
Was that chick at the end really a client?
We're signing up.
Ted, these chicks are desperate and hot. That's a perfect cocktail. Shake well, then sleep with.
Come on.
Ted, hurry, you gotta help me. My boat is sinking.
My boat is sinking.
Come on, Ted, this is an incredible opportunity. We'll meet our soulmates, nail 'em and never call them again. (chuckles)
Gosh, thanks, Ellen. I sure hope this works. I'm so done with the single life, all the games, the meaningless s*x.
That is so true, Ellen. I really think I'm ready to stop being a me and start being a we.
It's kinda hard to talk about with Ted here, but I just want someone who's not afraid to hold me at night when the tears come. Ellen, can you help me find her?
What?
Oh my God, people do that.
What's the hard way? Security roughs me up and tosses me out?
OK, Ted, let's go.
Hey, seriously, you have to stop doing that.
So did you get a good look at it?
Hit the horizontal ten-legged interspecies cha-cha?
Oh, yeah, we do that behind your back. Ted-out: to overthink. Also see Ted-up. Ted-up: to overthink something with disastrous results. Sample sentence: Billy Tedded up when
Wow, Ted, sounds like you're her perfect woman.
You wanna be her boyfriend. She already has a boyfriend. It's uncanny.
Come on, Lily, don't hate the player, hate the game.
The doctor will see you now.
(chuckles) Happy ending.
All right, see you later. Happy hunting.
Yeah, we're gonna make some crop circles.
No, it's like it'll change everything. Oh, Ted, you are so screwed.
Because I look good. Now focus, you and Marshall are roommates. You have an amazing apartment. Marshall and Lily just got engaged
So, you're not still gonna be his roommate when he gets married, are you? Someone's going to move out. So who's it gonna be?
You blew it, dude. Now that Lily's there, it's a whole new dynamic. They're edging you out.
Just keep your eyes open. That's all I'm saying, Ted. Little things are gonna be changing around that apartment.
Sort of on a date with her.

I found her online. I'm tired of the whole bar scene, the one-night hookups. I'm looking for a soul-mate, someone who I can love and cuddle, or so it says in my profile. (evil laugh) But this girl, she wants the same stuff and it's bumming me out. All right, Ted, call me from the hospital.
Well, stay tuned, I'm working on some stuff. But in the meantime, wish me luck.
Hello? Robin: Hi there, sexy.
Hello, Aunt Kathy, what's up?
An accident? Well, is Uncle Rudy gonna be OK? Robin: Aunt Kathy's got an itch that only you can scratch, big boy.
Oh God! Why did he think he could build his own helicopter?
Well, if he needs a transplant, he can have mine. I'll be right there.
See you guys later.
Told you. That Lily, she's a shrewd one.
Healthy communication? That's the worst idea ever. Look, you held off their first advance. That's good. Now it's time to counter-strike.
You gotta mark your territory, and I don't mean missing the toilet. You gotta do something big.
Bigger.
Katie's here. OK, real quick, last night, epiphany! I realized what the world of dating needs. Ready? A lemon law.

Exactly. From the moment the date begins you have five minutes to decide whether you're going to commit to an entire evening. And if you don't, it's no hard feelings just good night, thanks for playing, see you never. Huh? Huh? The lemon law, it's gonna be a thing, possibly starting right now.
Hi Katie. Barney.
Hm, yeah. Katie, you are about to be a part of history.
No, I'm a visionary. Lemon law, it's gonna be a thing!
No, wrong, lemon law is awesome.
OK, you're on a blind date, sitting across the table is that guy.
You really think it'll take more than five minutes to realize there will be no date number two?
Bad move, Scherbatsky.
Hi, have you met Robin?
(laughs) Time's running out, Scherbatsky. Last chance for the lemon law.
Say I'm right and this could all be over. This could be your call from the hospital.
So get this, I was on a date with this girl, Jackie.
What? You said she's fine. So, anyway, I was on date with this girl, Jackie.
Wow, Jackie, you make a really great first impression. I have a feeling that tonight you might end up being Jackie O.
It's out there, it's a thing. The lemon law is a thing. Damn, I should have called it Barney's law.
And to the lemon law.
Self-clink.
The Thankstini. A fun and delicious new novelty drink I invented. Cranberry juice, potato vodka and a bouillon cube. Tastes just like a turkey dinner.

Thanksgiving in a strip club, who's in? The Lusty Leopard has a surprisingly good Thanksgiving buffet. Plus, they do this thing. Heather dresses up as a pilgrim and Misty dresses up as an Indian, and they share a meal.
I'm sorry, Native American.
Canceling out Barney.
Excuse me, guys. Coming through.
Well, hi guys.
Oh, just the Lord's work.
Guys, OK, look, I don't advertise it, but I volunteer here. I think it's important to help the less fortunate. I'm the Angelina Jolie of incredibly hot guys.
I'm on it.
That's because I was trained by the best, Kendall.
Kendall, they're cool.
OK, well, I better get out there. There's a lot of food to give out. And a lot of smiles.
Man, it's amazing out there. I've done so much good today, I've got like a soul boner.
(laughs) You wanna scoop stuffing your first day out? Hello, NFL, can I be quarterback this Sunday? Dude.
So, wait, not only have you not done any good for anyone today, you're actually helping someone steal from the homeless. You know, Ted, it's called Thanksgiving, not Thankstaking. Damn.
Yeah, Right. Thanks.
Yeah, what's up?
Yeah, so.
That's my private personal business!
That's my private personal business.
I was unfairly punished because the wall belonged to the judge's church.
I peed in an alley which happened to have a church which I did not see because I was drunk.
OK, fine, so a judge is making me do this but I'm still doing it, and kicking ass at it, BTW.
When's the last time either of you did any good? Huh?
I can't believe that I told Kendall you guys were cool. I had 40 hours left on my community service and now I've got to spend it spearing trash on a freaking median strip.
Volunteer of the year!
Ted, I'm glad you asked.
Right? I told you so.
OK, Ted, I found a way for you to help someone, to do some good. This is Walter, and Walter is homeless. And Walter would like a lap dance.
I never joke about the sublime art of burlesque entertainment.

Ted, Walter's been to three shelter dinners. You know where he hasn't been? To heaven with Samantha. Look, it's the one chance you've had all day to help someone in need. Now buy this man a lap dance.
No, no.
That's ridiculous.
You gonna put out?
What? There's only one reason he's taking her to this dinner and it's not so little Mutu can get his malaria pills.
What? You done? Great. Check out table number four. See that little hottie on the end. She's short but has an ample bosom. I love it. She's like half-boob. Let's go.
Daddy's home.
Yeah.
Hm. Yeah, I think it's pretty solid.
(holding up small yellow piece of paper) Then Daddy wouldn't have gotten this seven-digit Father's Day card from Amy, huh?
Ted, your problem is all you do is think, think, think. I'm teaching you how to do, do, do.
Totally.
Oh yes it can.

Ted, I believe you and I met for a reason. It's like the universe was saying, hey, Barney, there's this dude, he's pretty cool but it's your job to make him awesome. Your brain screws you up, Ted. It gets in the way. It happened with Robin, it happened with half-boob. And it's gonna keep on happening until you power down that bucket of neuroses inebriation-style.
Oh no. I want you to do five shots.
No, don't think. Do.
Drink, drink, drink, drink...
Drink, drink, drink, drink, drink...
Yes! Drink, drink, drink...
Drink! Drink, drink...
I love it, I love it, I love it.
Drink, drink, drink, drink...
No....Dammit.
No, no, that's a great idea. That's the whole point of getting drunk. You do things you would never do in a million years if you were sober.
Ding, class dismissed. Here you go, kid, you call whoever you want.
Exactly. It's like, what's he gonna do next. I don't know, but I want to find out.
Hello.
The porcelain keeps the suit from wrinkling.
Don't worry, I slept through it. (laughs) I totally didn't sleep through it. For a little girl, you've got a big tank.
Oh, you put Ted to bed all right.
Hey, hey hey hey, he rallies. And the night begins now.
All right, game face on. Carl, two more. All right, all right, what do we think of this one?
Ehhh! Trick question, no thinking. You know what time it is? It's do o'clock. Let's ride.
Have you met Ted?
Excuse me.
You're calling Robin.
Ted, as your mentor and spiritual guide, I forbid you from calling her.
If you complete that call, I will set your coat on fire.
Real suede wouldn't have gone up so fast. You got robbed, this is a blend.
There's a girl in your bed.
Who is she?
Nice.
No, after I hosed you down with a beverage gun, I brought you back here.

Really, Lily? Even if I were to mention, oh, I don't know... your kindergarten class's pet guinea pig?
Marshall?
The calzone?
Robin.
The Mr. T dream...
Ted?
The ballet class.
The 'N Sync concert.
Okay, Ted. The thermos.
I do! So be cool!
Thermos.
I only have one rule. Never, ever, ever meet a girl's parents.
Not even if her mom's hot.
I'd love to meet your parents.
No, Scooby, you, uh... stay!
Yeah, me, too.
I'd love to. (He kisses her) There's just one little thing, and it probably doesn't matter, but... I don't want to get married. I've been saying that all night just to get in your pants.
Can you believe...
Wait... Nora, wait. Wait. I'm sorry I misled you.
I was on the spot. This is your fault.
Yeah, with the whole "I want to get married" thing. You can't just tell someone exactly what you want out of a relationship. This... isn't England.
Uh, yeah. Isn't that him taking a leak on that fire hydrant?
Okay. Lily, I'm sorry that I lied about wanting to settle down.

Okay. Maybe, eventually, I could settle down. 50 years from now, if I have like a Hefner thing going on with some really hot twins. But those twins won't even be born for another... 32 years. I mean... Nora's great. She's wonderful. But...
Last night? 8:30.
I lied.
When I said I lied, that was a lie, and I'm sorry.
So am I. This, all of this, this is totally new to me, but I know it's what I want. I want to be confused. With you.
Hi. I'm Barney. Great to meet you. Hey, you want to see a magic trick?

Ted. This is your seduction lounge. s*x swing there, vibrating Jell-O pit right there, rotating Vietnamese Shame Wheel right here. Don't ask; you're not ready. And that basketball hoop? Outdoor stripper pole. We'll just tell the ladies to be careful in the winter. You think a tongue stuck to a frozen pole is bad...
Oh, thank God. I'll go first. Ted, this hous you bought for your hypothetical family is super weird. We talk about it all the time behind your back.
Sure thing. Luis. Barney Stinson, 12 H. I got a hundred bucks if you can be here in five. Thanks.
Yeah... here's the thing about me and tools... the only one I know how to use is attached to me, and I am not going to try putting it in the TV. Again.
Well, here's our screwdriver now. (Barney opens the door, then whispers loudly:) Guys, I'm pretty sure that's not Luis, but I can't be certain. Someone introduce yourself.
Dad?
Where do I begin?
Yeah. I think I need a drink.
Look, it's been 30 years. And now you just show up out of nowhere? This is... this is going to take me a minute.
I love you, Daddy. I'm so glad we're best friends now.
Make a muscle.
Ah!
Guys, my dad's awesome. He's the mother of all fathers. Check this out.
Hey, back when I was a kid, you used to be a roadie. Do you still do that?
So, all these years, there's this one question I've been dying to ask him.
Do you... get laid a lot?
Oh, my God, that took you five seconds.
You're a master. You are legen... wait for it...
Oh, that's cool.
This is going to be the second-most fun I've ever had on an Asian leg. (both laughing)
What do you mean?

First of all, Robin, my dad could beat up your dad. Second, you don't have to worry. He's cool. Now if you'll excuse me... I have to go renew my passport, and get a travel-sized rotating Vietnamese Shame Wheel. Don't ask; you're not ready.
I'm not sure how to start this.
I think I need a drink.
Glen McKenna, neat.
Milk? Oh, you're taking it easy. Crazy night?
Wow.
Hey, um.. When I was a kid, you used to be a roadie. You still do that?
Yeah, no, I get it. Um, but when I was a kid, you... you were this total badass.
Yeah, okay, now we're getting to the good stuff.
Yes, yes, yes.
*Out of control.*
You ever bang Stevie Nicks?
Big-time.
Oh, my God, you're a natural. Think of the pickup plays we can run as a father-son duo. There's the "Father Knows Breast," there's the "Bush Dynasty," the "Lick Father, Lick Son."
Why?
You're all wearing matching sweaters. That's cute. Look, I got to get going, Jerry. But, uh, this was great. Glad we did this.
What?
No, I most certainly am not. Look, I met him. He's not my kind of bro and that's that.
Guys, get it through your heads. I am never gonna talk to my dad again.
Fine, I'll go.
Oh, thank you very much. And I love your...coat. I love your coat.
Well, I do love it. It's doing a nice job covering up that chair.
It ages well, that's the thing.
I do remember that. I climbed up on that dude's lap and told him what I wanted for Christmas.
J.J., I'm talking to Dad right now. God.
Yeah, I do. I make a ton of money. How much do you make, J.J.?
Oh, well, huh, now we all know you make excuses. I was talking about money.
Good time to get into print media. Am I right, Dad?
Uh, you don't strike me as the athletic type, Jayj. Dad, check it. Triceps. What gym do you go to?
Sounds like you're having your fourth period. Am I right, Dad?!
Why? J.J. started it. What does J.J. even stand for anyway? J... Jerky... Jerkface?
Jerome Jr...? Oh. He's... he's named after you. Excuse me.
This is mine.
J.J. gets a childhood, a dad, a real family and a basketball hoop? No, no. I at least get the hoop. I'm taking it with me.
Why? Why should I? You're lame, okay? You're just some lame suburban dad.
Because if you were gonna be some lame suburban dad, why couldn't you have been that for me?!
Oh, "screwed up" doesn't even begin to describe...
Can you help me with this?
Bye.
I'm fine. Hey, Ted.
You, uh, still want a basketball hoop out there?
No, you were right. A kid needs a hoop.
Ted, why are you dating our arch-enemy?! I mean, Wile E. Coyote wasn't trying to sleep with the Roadrunner.
Quit GNB?! Why?
Saving chicken bones and an old boot to make hobo soup? Marshall, you can't pay your mortgage with Hacky Sacks and good vibes.

Well, then, you're not going to be able to pay for that trip to Spain that you've been planning. (Barney snickers) Say good-bye to riding around in gondolas, and eating bratwurst and seeing the pyramids.
Well, I know that a trip there costs some serious lira.
Where? I want his autograph!
Yeah. I've been there, too. Every time I'm done having s*x with a woman, at first,I never want to see her again. No, that's pretty much it.
No! You can't quit tomorrow! The lady with the big nipples is coming back to give another sexual harassment seminar, and I bribed one of the maintenance guys to keep the room at a brisk 55 degrees!
It starts with an... "L?"
And I said my name was...?
It's always the one in the turtleneck, Ted. And no, I don't want to play. Stupid Marshall-... ruined everything.
I'm sorry. Sorry. Something Hershel said at work today.
What, don't you guys know Hershel? Didn't I tell you? Oh, he's the new lawyer who replaced Marshall at GNB. He is so awesome and funny and tall... taller than Marshall... and he knows way more laws.
There's no Hershel! I was just saying that to make you jealous! Why do you insist we play these games?
Just come back to GNB already!
That's how I'm gonna use mine.
Care? I don't care. I'm like, whatever. Marshall who? He's stupid. Hershel's way better.

Oh! Ugh! You are worse than my shrink. "Barney, we have to talk about your father." "Barney, I'm not going to teach you how to hypnotize people. You'll only use it for evil." "Barney, I am not going to conduct a couples session "between you and this woman. She's obviously a prostitute." I don't need this!

Hey, Marshall, it's me. Listen, I know I've been kind of a jerk about your leaving GNB. I just wanted to call and say I'm sorry. No apologies necessary. We're good. Good. Um, hey, any chance you might maybe... I don't know... if you're not busy, uh, want to have lunch today?
Oh, that's cool. No biggie. Another time.
How long have you been there?
Oh, no, I'm fine.
There's nothing to talk about.
I don't want to talk about it, okay?
Because I don't. And why am I explaining this to you? You're the most secretive person I know. You never tell anybody anything.
That's... the most harrowing story I've ever heard. Is it true?
Fine! The reason I'm upset about Marshall leaving GNB is... is...the meatball sub.
It all started months ago in the GNB commissary. It was Meatball Sub Day.
Oh, how I used to love Meatball Sub Day. And then, the most humiliating moment of my life.

I plotted my revenge for weeks. But nothing seemed right. Then it hit me. The answer was so elegant and simple-- an exploding meatball sub. For months, I experimented. More... marinara sauce. Finally, the sub was perfected. The plan was in place. The snare was baited. And then...
Eat this meatball sub.
I don't have much time!
What? That's... What is that word you taught me? "Bull" something?
But you're supposed to take me to see that Zeppelin cover band next week. The night is gonna be... Led-and-Jerry.
A drunk audience.
Bye.
I am so angry at my dad! Guess who called me today. Go on, guess.
My dad!
Barney Stinson.
Ooh, hold on, let me check my personality. Oh, no. Turns out I would never do that in a million years.
You do not know how right you are.
Zero right! We're not getting too old for anything.

I have to face an ugly truth. Jerry Whittaker, my own father, is anti-awesome-etic. I know Crazy Jerry's still in there somewhere, but he's trapped under 20 years of lawnmower parties and carpool barbecues.
Okay, my dad's almost here. I need everything to be as awesome as possible tonight.

I can't have any single female friends lying around. My dad'll be all, Why don't you marry Robin? You guys are cute together. Deep down, you know you were never happier than when you were with her. Uh... (chuckles) no, thanks.
And... hence new identities.
Jerry, you remember Marshall... he's a well-known writer.
Lily, his wife.
Wait, wait. Jerry, I got to tell you the truth. Guys, I'm gonna tell him. We're also a band.
Oh, we're not drinking here. Tonight we're going big. Let's see, what club should we hit first? There's Club Was, there's Wrong...
Oh, no.
No, Was wasn't where Where was, Was was where Wrong was, right?
Guys, focus.
No, Was was Closed. Once Was shut down, it reopened as Closed.
No, Shut up shut down. I can't believe I don't know the clubs anymore.
It's hopeless, isn't it?
I know. Daddy's home. And Granddaddy's home! Tonight rocks so hard!
Man, isn't this place great?
Uh, L-Lily, uh, talk about your open marriage.
Let's do shots.
No. Don't you remember what you said to me when I was a kid? "Never stop partying."
You don't remember the last thing you said to me when I was a kid? Well... you know, why don't you just go back home?
Yeah, well, I want to hang out with Crazy Jerry, not Stay-at-Home Jerome.
Can you believe it? This is awesome!
I finally know what it's like to be embarrassed by my dad.
Hey, uh, hey, Jerry, y... you really want to be out here like this?
No, of course not. I... I just...
Yeah! Let's do it! Uh, maybe fix the tie. But mostly, party!
(laughing): Hey, hey! There we go!
It's okay, Dad. I never thought tonight would be so awesome! So... next stop, strip club. The Lusty Leopard has a special...
What?
But all those crazy things you did.
A drunk audience.
No, no, no. You don't even know! Right here!
What just happened?
Well, why do all those things?
You lied to me all night for your own selfish reasons? Daddy...!
Hey, you know, a... a pretty good magician like you probably knows how to, say, get out of a standard set of handcuffs.
Well, here's something you didn't know... I'm a pretty good magician, too. (They escape and run away) Abracadabra!
We need someplace to hide.
No, Jerry, this is not the time to go to another club! We've got to get you back home in time for that trip. But there's no more trains, there's no cabs.
Step on it! Jerry...
Jerry, we have got to get you home in time for that fishing trip.
This is no time for laws!
I am not going to buckle up!
How did you do it?
How did you become this? I mean, I love my life, but... I'm not sure I like loving it. Sure, strip clubs...
Hey, I'm trying to open up to you...
When I think about going for anything more than that, I look at my life, and who I am, and... I'm too far gone. I'm broken.
This... sucks.

Invitations for the demolition of The Arcadian. As head of the project, I get to decide how we knock it down. I'm torn between training an actual coyote to use an ACME dynamite plunger, or hooking up a fuse to Eddie Van Halen's guitar that goes off the second he hits the last note to "Hot For Teacher." Barney! Barney! Bar... No, no. I'm going to go coyote.

Oh, come on. Zoey's not shutting anything down, standing out there with her stupid megaphone, screaming in the wind; butt cheeks trembling with fury; her perky breasts heaving; her self-righteous nipples...
Point is, we are taking her and The Arcadian down. Am I right, Teddy Westside?
Glad to know she's also mouthy in a good way. What up? Dude, that's his girlfriend.
Not only do you quit the job I stuck my neck out to get you, now you sabotage the project I'm in charge of? Is this because I brushed Lily's boob with my elbow, the other day?
I mean this is really like...
No. I' was... I was...

Kent! Kent!
That's what you get, you traitor!
Yeah. Really.
I'm a B-plus. My whole life, I was hoping to be an A, and I'm a B-plus. And I'm okay with that.
Hey there, darlin'. How you doin'? Ah, is this your sister? Mmm... Beautiful. Mmm...
Show me chicken wings!
Do you know what I had to do to get you that job?
What, wear a wrinkled suit and not give a damn about what your hair looked like?
Oh, my God.
Ever since my father walked out on my childhood, I've had serious abandonment issues. You walking out on me like that...
It made me wonder, "What could I have done to make him stay?"
That's what everyone keeps saying but people just keep leaving me.
Your place or mi... Your place or mi... Le-Let's go to your place. Mm.
I love you.
Uh, no. N-Not right...
You have some coffee? So I can throw it in this traitor's face?
I love you. Uh, no. N-not right...
What kind of dirtbag doesn't stand by his best friends, but instead sides with some self-righteous bitch with a pointless cause and a megaphone?
Whoa, whoa, you have got to be kidding me. Ted...
Okay, okay. A couple of things. Lily, how'd I do?
Secondly, Ted, I'm sorry I said mean things about Zoey. Are you really going to walk away from this project just because you're mad at me?
I understand. Zoey has magic lady bits.
Zoey's lady bits... are magic, and that's how she controls your mind. You see, every few hundred millennia, lady bits leap forward...
I once knew such a girl.
It was last call. In this very bar.
What...?! No... What?!...No... What?!
Come on. This is so about the girl.
Oh, you're not sorry now, Ted Mosby. But you will be. You... will... be. (laughing harder and louder) That's how you do an evil laugh. Ciao for now.
Hi, Arthur. Everything okay?
Isn't that animal cruelty?
Oh. That's fine, then. So listen, you know Ted, the architect?

So, if Ted stood up at that big meeting tomorrow and said that he thought The Arcadian should be a landmark... You wouldn't just fire him, would you? (laughing uncomfortably) Right? You wouldn't just... You wouldn't just... yeah...
Come again for Big Fudge?
Can you believe that?! I can't be unemployed, Robin! My job is my identity; It's who I am. It gives me the confidence I need to convince girls I'm a fighter pilot.
I don't understand. Why would you fire me?
By being the best architect available?
By... being Latino?
Guys, I'm telling you, if Ted Mosby isn't fantastic, fire me.
Damn it! I was kidding?
I'm not kidding! Oh, by the way, Arthur, uh, how are things with you and your wife?
We'll end up out of a job, all thanks to some stupid, only sort of awesome lion head.
We should totally buy a bar!
The only court where you show up, then get served.
Oh, this ought to be good.
Oh, this is good!
Hey, Arthur!
Listen, Arthur, Marshall's wife has an idea for how we can save, not saving The Arcadian.
Uh... Hey, Arthur?

I don't know, she may have been right about that lion's head. It gave The Arcadian a regal elegance. Then again, it goes really nice with my duvet. (He takes out a normal size screw driver) I hope I used the right screws.
I want to press it!
I want to press it!
You know what might... make you feel better, buddy?
I want to press the button!
Yeah. Getting to stand next to me while I press the button. That is going to be legend... wait for it...dary adjacent. Legendary adjacent!
Are these people Irish, Polish, blondes... what are we dealing with here?
Not possible. Your building is new. And I have one rule: New is always better.
Ah, but "new is always better" is my oldest rule, which makes it the best.
Oh, hey, buddy.
I wonder what end it's coming out of Lily right now.
I bet it's both. Hey, speaking of explosions... enough already, Ted! That button's mine!
I got you this job, so I... Say what?
You...
Who's that from?
Why would Ted get back together with Zoey? He's doing great.
No, I refuse to believe that Ted is getting back with Zoey because of lightbulbs.
Ted, I only have one rule.
We've got to stop Ted. Where are they meeting?
Well, that's good. All we have to do is think back to the time Ted told us about his first date with Zoey.
You weren't listening either?
That's the intersection.
Way ahead of ya.
I know. They're a total train wreck.
Yeah, almost as bad as us.
What about me? I got so fat, at the end of a date, you'd unhook my bra.
Thank God we're not sentimental saps who panic and get back together. Seriously, why would people do that?
What do you mean?
Yeah... he did. And... she loved him, too. Didn't she?
Maybe this isn't the intersection.
She's alone! There's still time! But where the hell is Ted?
Brilliant. But wait, he had a huge head start on us. There's no way he's still in there unless he spent a half an hour picking out the perfect orchid.
But... it's a mistake.
He is.
Yeah. You earned it.
Always.
It's just a button. Can we talk about something else, please? (Barney sees Norah, Robin says something to him that we can"t hear, then Barney walks up to Norah) Norah.
How you been?

Look, I don't know why you would possibly say yes to this, but would you want to grab a cup of coffee with me sometime? 20 minutes. I was such a jerk to you. You can spend the entire time calling me every dirty name in the book.
I'll call you. You look beautiful, by the way. And here I thought it was too late for sundresses.
Challenge accepted.
What do you think of this tie?
What do you think of this tie?
This one is better?

I'm not scared. It's just that I think once I'd put this tie, I could never remove it. I should wear it again and again. And of course this tie is fine now, but how I will cope when it becomes big and it annoy me? Do I made a mistake? Is what I would have been happier with the other tie? Ted, I can tell you a big secret?
I do not really talk about the tie.
I wonder if this will be a disaster. And if it was the worst of all marriage?
That of Punchy.
Yeah, no problem, of course.
Woow.
Ted, you can hit you something else to this marriage.Let the big binder. The only thing you have to bring it to Cleveland.
Here's your speech. "In single file, girls. No big. "
Yeah, you're right. This is Cleveland. "In single file, girls. "
I'll call you.
I did not call.
I'm not a wimp. Nora wanted a professional. Not me.That's it. And yes, Robin, I want chicken wings.
Stand ready, Cleveland. The last guy who has conned you so hard and then disappeared was LeBron James.
What?
It's not just be someone. This is a market survey. You see, my legendary success rate of 83%...
We'll never know unless I try tonight.
Prisoners on the run are not sexy. At the same time it was a faulty concept. Next step, the patient zero.

Wait, wait, wait, before you leave, please do respond to this survey to help me better to seduce you in the future.What does not work for you in this game of seduction? Does A do not you think that I hold a bailiff of the world? B or fingernails disgusts you? (He shows her nails, very long and the girl goes away) Sea...
Take that. Shows them how much you're great. Say your ad, not ashamed, say that.
It does not work for you because A vampires are offside, B or pretend that I invented Facebook was a bit too?
I know what you gonna say. Show in Cleveland, how it goes.
Sorry. Oh, my God, this is Nora. She finally ended up reminding me.

I lied. I called, like, five times. Wait, wait! You guys you know better than anyone how I show this stuff. Will you help me please? I would like just once to see what it feels like when you do not quite fair.
Hi Nora. Thank you for reminding me. The reason I'm calling...
To tell you how I feel.
I know it did not work the first time...
Is there a part of you that wants to try again?
I chose the right tie, huh?
You're a good best man, Ted. You'll cry during the toast, right?
Between.

Oh, nothing. I must have coffee with Nora. She is still angry, so I need some "sympathy points". She loves musicals, so I'll tell him that I fell off stage during a performance of "Man of La Mancha." What do you think?
A one-man show... I love it!
You're right. A cervical neck brace! Thank you, Lil. I should have to talk to you soon. I trained all day with these crutches and one who has left in my hall is likely to need it.
Hi Nora, thank you for coming.
My naked...? Oh, that's nothing. I was playing in a One Man Show at Fiddler. There was this scene...
Wait, Nora, waiting... No, please. I'm sorry.

Someone who likes you, really. And suspicious, and probably accurately you do it over more later, and therefore he feels the need... I'm sorry, you spoke of this fantastic pair of tits, right? Because I seek, and I do not see them.
Okay, I did not know. Mea culpa. So, from now, more lies. I never lie to you. I'm serious. Ask me anything.
Have I ever... If I'm totally honest... Yes.
More than once... Wow, this is... I guess if we... so, technically, there were a number of times I've lied to a woman to sleep with her.
Nine or ten for most. There has been a 4 once. It was an easy girl.But, Nora, after that, I had to flee so fast. Honesty is good.
You want me to tell all the lies I have told to put a woman in my bed?

We just sent you a picture of her from six months ago.
When little Jack's not turning double plays, he's turning heads with this home run of an outfit!
I'll be right there.
And we bang chicks in Ted's room.
Man, I can't believe these are vegan.
I'll make Ted swear not to tell anyone what he knows about you, and he'll cave immediately.
Nice.
Then we pretend to break up.
God, you're smart!
Oh, really, Marshall? Nothing comes to mind?
Wait-wait-wait a minute!
You'll have to buy me a couple of cocktails first.
She made reservations for two deluxe rooms, massages, and dinner at the Palm, and in return, I made her cookies.
New plan: Meet me at the entrance in five minutes.
